trial_identification.studytitle: Arthroscopic Treatment of Painful Snapping of the Scapula by using a New Superior Portal
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Arthroscopic Treatment of Painful Snappingof the Scapula by using a New Superior Portal

interventions.interventions: Arthroscopic surgery of the scapula using a new superior portal for an established operative procedure. Single surgical procedure < 1 hour duration on one occasion only

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety, ease and better access and visualisation to allow resection of the superomedial corner of the scapula
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Single operative procedure and follow up average of 11.5 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Reduction in pre-operative pain (VAS 0-10), the time to return to work and previous sporting activity

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Painful snapping scapula (>12 months) who failed adequate conservative treatment : non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS); local injection of corticosteroids and physiotherapy with scapular adduction and postural shoulder shrug exercises.

trial_design.designfeatures: All patients had a diagnosis of painful snapping scaplua, confirmed by clinical examination, a normal plain X-Ray and MRI excluding bony abnormalities.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Melbourne Shoulder and Elbow Centre Brighton Orthopaedic Clinic 31 Normanby St., Brighton 3186, Victoria

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Pain and crepitus (a scraping feel and sound) can occur at the scapula (shoulder blade) restricting the shoulder's normal gliding motion. Previous studies have shown that removing a small supero medial portion of the scapula bone can correct this. This can be done arthroscopically (key hole surgery) but this area is difficult to see and access. We have previously published an article on anatomic studies demonstrating a safe new 'key hole' position which allows experienced arthroscopists better access to enable removal of the 'troublesome' bone. In this study we evaluated the outcome of patients who had this procedure with regard to their good and excellent return to work and sport. All patients thought it was worthwhile having the operation.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Published. Attila Pavlik, Kian Ang, Jennifer Coghlan, Simon Bell."Arthroscopic Treatment of Painful Snapping of the Scapula by Using a New Superior Portal Arthroscopy, Vol 19, No.6 (July-August), 2003 pp 608-612

contact.name: Simon Bell
contact.address: Melbourne Shoulder and Elbow Centre Brighton Orthopaedic Clinic 31 Normanby St., Brighton 3186, Victoria
